title: Love Island winner Greg O'Shea to star in inaugural international rugby tournament

Love Island star Greg O'Shea will look to get his rugby career back on track as he represents Ireland in inaugural RugbyX tournament at The O2 Arena on October 29.

O'Shea, a former Ireland Under 20s player, put his rugby career briefly on hold to head into the Love Island villa this summer, winning the hit reality TV show alongside Amber Gill before their split.

The 24-year-old is now set to shun the showbiz lifestyle to focus his efforts on making it to the Tokyo 2020 Olympics as part of Ireland's Rugby Sevens squad, who started training for the competition in August.

He will now join his team-mates in the innovative new short-format, full-contact version of the game making its debut in London later this month.

(Image: Getty Images)

It will be O'Shea's first major rugby appearance since his Love Island win, as he joins fellow 2019 Hong Kong Sevens winners Billy Tardis, Terry Kennedy, Harry McNuly, Mark Roche and Adam Levy in the Ireland squad.

They will take on England and Barbarians in Group A, with former England scrum-half Danny Care coaching the Barbarians side.

The USA, France and Argentina will take part in Group B, with former sprinter turned Sevens sensation Carlin Isles, the fastest player in world rugby, in the America side.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

RugbyX will feature 5v5 matches taking place over 10 minutes with no half-time interval.

Each squad features 12 players with seven rolling substitutes.

(Image: REX)

Line-outs are replaced by quick throws and there are three-person scrums, five points for a try, no conversions, drop goals or penalties and drawn matches settled by a unique one-on-one showdown for the try line.

Technical Director Ben Ryan, said: “We are excited with the standard of players that teams have selected for the first RugbyX tournament.

(Image: Getty Images)

"It shows that unions are eager to put in a strong performance and players really want to try the new format especially inside the O₂ Arena.

"As promised, fans can expect an elite level of performance with some of the best Sevens players from across the world”.

Men's and Women's competitions will take place in parallel over two 2.5 hour sessions.
description: Love Island winner Greg O'Shea is making his first major rugby appearance since leaving the villa at the RugbyX tournament this month
